metadata.title: CVE-2020-22028 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer Overflow vulnerability exists in FFmpeg 4.2 in filter_vertically_8at libavfilter/vf_avgblur.c, which could cause a remote Denial of Service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-22028` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavcodec58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavdevice58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavfilter7 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavformat-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavformat-extra58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavformat58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavutil56 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libpostproc55 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libswresample3 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libswscale5 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2').
